results.firPara: • Russian authorities retreat on perceived official support of scenes in Marseille
results.secPara: On Tuesday, there was something of a rollback of Russian official support for the fan violence that has dogged the early days of Euro 2016. A day previously, the MP Igor Lebedev, who sits on the executive board of the Russian football union, said he saw nothing wrong with the scenes Quite the opposite lads, keep it up! The top law enforcement official Vladimir Markin said the fans were real men and Europe had become too used to gay parades to recognise them as such.
results.webTitle: Euro 2016: Russia rolls back support of violence as deportation process begins

results.firPara: The worlds highest-paid athlete is about to start his fourth European Championship and, after scoring 32 goals for his country since the last one, he really is a superstar with nothing left to prove
results.secPara: The worlds highest-paid athlete is about to start his fourth European Championship and, after scoring 32 goals for his country since the last one, he really is a superstar with nothing left to prove
results.webTitle: Just give the ball to Cristiano Ronaldo – Portugal’s Plan A (and B) | Barney Ronay

results.firPara: Swiss coach is regarded as a national hero in Austria after guiding his team through qualifying for a major tournament for the first time since 1998
results.secPara: After Marcel Kollers appointment as Austria coach almost five years ago, he was sneered at, criticised and questioned. Before taking the job, the former Switzerland midfielder had indifferent managerial spells in Germany with Köln and Bochum, where he was sacked in 2009. Now he is regarded in Austria as der Nationalheld – the national hero. It is recognition for me that we have developed something, said Koller. Under him, Austria have soared from 77th in the Fifa rankings to inside the top 10, ahead of England and France.
results.webTitle: Marcel Koller brings Austria in from the cold and ready for Euro 2016 | Ben Fisher

results.firPara: • Dutchman joins Goodison club on a £6m-a-year deal
results.secPara: Everton have confirmed the appointment of Ronald Koeman as their manager, with the Dutch coach signing a three-year deal to succeed Roberto Martínez at Goodison Park.
results.webTitle: Ronald Koeman confirmed as Everton manager after leaving Southampton

results.firPara: She took Eastern to the Hong Kong Premier league title at the age of just 27. And now she has her eyes on a job in Europe
results.secPara: Forget the East Midlands, perhaps the biggest story of the football year is in east Asia, where Eastern won the Hong Kong Premier League title in April. The wait since the last championship had been 21 years but the headlines were all about the 27 year-old head coach Chan Yuen-ting.
results.webTitle: Chan Yuen-ting: the female coach who took a men's team to a national title

results.firPara: Juventus have completed the signing of Miralem Pjanic for £25.4m (€32m) from Roma on a five-year contract.
results.secPara: The Bosnia-Herzegovina midfielder had been linked with Chelsea, where the Italy manager Antonio Conte will take over before the new Premier League season. However he has instead opted to join the Serie A champions.
results.webTitle: Miralem Pjanic completes €32m transfer to Juventus from Roma

results.firPara: Todays rumours are making the best of things

results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Chelsea and Barcelona battle for Samuel Umtiti?

results.secPara: • Says level of segregation at England-Russia game was unacceptable
results.webTitle: Euro 2016: FA’s Greg Dyke lambasts Uefa failings in Marseille and fears violence in Lille

results.firPara: Sepp Blatter, the disgraced former Fifa president, has claimed he witnessed the fixing of a draw for a European football competition.
results.secPara: Blatter, in an interview with Argentinian newspaper La Nacion, did not elaborate on which competition he believed was rigged, but said he had seen a practice whereby the balls containing team names were cooled to make their identification possible when being picked out.
results.webTitle: Sepp Blatter: European competition draw was rigged by cooling balls

results.firPara: Well, there you have it folks. Who would have thought one of the best, if not the best game of the tournament would be from two teams who technically had nothing to play for. Tecatito Corona is an absolute talent and Porto better hold on to him for as long as they can because he just turned in a performance the highest quality. But taking nothing away from Venezuela as I am done with the good for them rhetoric. They can play and they will be a major threat to Argentina. In front of a hostile environment, they delivered and really have done their nation proud.
results.secPara: Mexico remain unbeaten in 22 matches but hand Osorio his first result that doesnt end up in a win. Venezuela have now conceded a goal but its quite clear that they dont make it easy.
results.webTitle: Mexico 1-1 Venezuela: Copa América – as it happened
